title: All Time Low's 'Last Young Renegade' is a Must-Listen
summary: Themes include regret, growing up, and wondering just where your life is heading. The production on ‘Last Young Renegade’ is something else. It has a more mature and atmospheric sound than anything else you will find on All Time Low’s back catalogue. It is also incredibly cinematic, with lots of orchestral backing and sound effects. There are some real stand-out moments in this production, particularly the ending of ‘Walls’ (during which you will believe someone has hit the rewind button on their CD player)

content.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("h2",null,"The Lyrics Are Darker Than Ever Before"),mdx("p",null,`The lyrics on \u2018Last Young Renegade\u2019 are more introspective than ever before. Themes include regret, growing up, and wondering just where your life is heading. This is most obvious in the songs \u2018Hollow Bedroom\u2019 and \u2018Walls\u2019.
All Time Low frontman Alex Gaskarth has often spoken about how he feels his lyrics are important to fans. It seems that on this album he has put a lot of himself into the songs, leaving them to be much more meaningful than ever before.`),mdx("h2",null,"The Production Is Bigger Than Ever"),mdx("p",null,`The production on \u2018Last Young Renegade\u2019 is something else. It has a more mature and atmospheric sound than anything else you will find on All Time Low\u2019s back catalogue. It is also incredibly cinematic, with lots of orchestral backing and sound effects, making it the perfect soundtrack for a late-night drive.
In terms of genre, it could be described as melodic pop with elements of rock, electronica, and even gospel. There are some real stand-out moments in this production, particularly the ending of \u2018Walls\u2019 (during which you will believe someone has hit the rewind button on their CD player).
All in all, this is a record that you need to listen to with a good pair of headphones to fully appreciate its brilliance.`),mdx("h2",null,"How To Download And Where To Stream"),mdx("p",null,"You can get your hands on a physical or digital copy of All Time Low\u2019s \u2018Last Young Renegade\u2019 right now. To download, you can head to iTunes or Amazon and pre-order the album. Alternatively, you can stream it on Spotify or Apple Music."),mdx("p",null,"If you want to get your hands on a physical copy, then you can do so by clicking here to buy on Amazon. You can also pre-order the \u2018Deluxe\u2019 or \u2018Deluxe Vinyl\u2019 versions to get them even earlier. If you are looking for a digital copy, then you can do so by clicking here to buy on iTunes."),mdx("h2",null,"Track By Track Breakdown"),mdx("p",null,"As mentioned above, there is a much darker tone running throughout \u2018Last Young Renegade\u2019. With that in mind, here is a breakdown of the tracks and their meanings:"),mdx("ul",null,mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"Hollow Bedroom - The first track on the album, this sees the protagonist, \u2018Alex\u2019, moving out of home and into a new life. It explores the feelings of regret, loneliness, and uncertainty that come with this kind of transition.")),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"Walls - Arguably the most powerful track on the record, \u2018Walls\u2019 sees Alex reflecting on his life and the choices he has made. It is an introspective, but hopeful, track that leaves you with a feeling of optimism.")),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"Last Young Renegade - The title track to the album, \u2018Last Young Renegade\u2019 sees the protagonist accept their age, but also looks forward to the future and the path they will walk.")),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"Dirty Lovers - \u2018Dirty Lovers\u2019 sees the protagonist indulge in something that they know is wrong. It is a track that explores the risk and thrill of doing something that you know isn\u2019t right.")),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"Kids In The Dark - \u2018Kids In The Dark\u2019 sees the protagonist come to terms with the fact that, as wrong as their actions are, they are doing it for their future self. It is an exploration of saying sorry to one\u2019s younger self.")),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"Walls (Wailing Walls) - This is the \u2018Walls\u2019 track from the album, but with an added verse from Sound Of The Wailing Wall, a fictional character from the \u2018Last Young Renegade\u2019 story. It is a slower, darker take on the original track.")),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"Close Your Eyes And Say Goodbye - Another track that deals with regret, \u2018Close Your Eyes And Say Goodbye\u2019 sees the protagonist ask the question, \u201CWhy do we always watch the ones we love leave?\u201D It is a track that deals with the feeling of letting go.")),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"Exotic - \u2018Exotic\u2019 is a track that has a lot of sexual connotations, but also explores the idea of exotic sounding places. It is about taking risks, exploring the world, and travelling.")),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"International Waters - \u2018International Waters\u2019 is a track about growing up, leaving the past behind, and looking towards the future. It is about leaving the shores of your home and setting out on a new journey.")),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"Dark Side Of Your Own Atmosphere - This track sees the protagonist exploring a relationship that they know is wrong. It is the fantasy of falling in love with someone who doesn\u2019t feel the same.")),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"Trapdoor - \u2018Trapdoor\u2019 is a track about leaving behind the person you once were, so that you can be someone new. It is about letting go of the past and embracing the future.")),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"What If I Go? - The final track on the album, \u2018What If I Go?\u2019 sees the protagonist come to terms with what they have done and decide to live their life as best they can from then on out.")),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"Excess Baggage - This track is a bonus song that features on the Deluxe Vinyl version of the album. It is about letting go of the person you used to be to become the person you want to be."))),mdx("h2",null,"Final Words END^^END^^END^^END^^END^^END^^END^^END^^END^^END^^END^^END^^END^ >"),mdx("p",null,`All Time Low\u2019s \u2018Last Young Renegade\u2019 is a significant record for the band. It sees them take a much more mature approach to songwriting, whilst still managing to keep their classic ATL sound.
If you are a fan of pop or rock music, or even just looking to try something new, then this is the album for you. It is a record that will change the way you think about music.`),mdx("p",null,`Now it\u2019s time for you to grab your headphones and get listening to All Time Low\u2019s \u2018Last Young Renegade\u2019. We hope you enjoy it as much as we do!
END^^END^^END^^END^^END^^END^^END^^END^^END^^END^^END^^END^^END^^END^ >`),mdx("h2",null),mdx("h2",null,"---"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Beach House's '7' Is a Dreamy Masterpiece
"The Hateful Eight" Is a Quentin Tarantino Tour De Force
Hip Hop Music with a Purpose: The Importance of Awareness in the Music Industry

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...s}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...s,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`The music industry is vast, expansive, and unending. The number of subgenres and variations within the larger genres is innumerable. It\u2019s also an industry that has recently come under fire for its lack of diversity and representation in regards to gender, sexuality, religion, race, and so much more. As a result of these issues becoming more apparent and publicized, artists have been producing music with a purpose; focusing on important topics and causes through their music.
If you spend any time listening to rap or hip-hop music, you\u2019ve probably noticed how many songs are about money, sex, drugs, partying\u2014basically all the things you can do when you\u2019re rich and famous. But there are some rappers who are using their fame to make a difference in the world by speaking out about problems that need to be addressed: social injustice, poverty, drug abuse, child exploitation and other serious issues. These artists are making a conscious effort to use their music to make a positive impact on society rather than just focusing on things like materialism or promiscuity.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: "Imitation of Life" Is a Thought-Provoking Drama about Race and Identity
Foster the People's 'Sacred Hearts Club' Is a Fun Ride
Chvrches' 'Love Is Dead' Is a Pop Gem

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`In today\u2019s musical landscape, popular electronic music has taken over the pop world. But there are still some great pop albums that aren\u2019t filled with auto-tune and EDM drops.On May 25th, the Scottish band Chvrches released their third album called \u201C Love is Dead.\u201D The synth-pop band has lots of happy vibes and catchy hooks on their new album. It\u2019s a pleasant listen but might not be what you expect if you only know them from their first two albums. The band took a left turn creatively, covering topics like technology, isolation and death rather than dancing around in your bedroom to this record.
Chvrses has gained more popularity among a different group of fans by releasing this album than they ever did with their first two releases combined. This is partially because they have expanded their audience by collaborating on songs with Haim and Bleachers recently as well as making this change in sound so now they have crossover appeal to radio listeners too!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Father John Misty's 'Pure Comedy' Is a Hilarious Masterpiece

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...a}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...a,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`While there has been some great music released this year, the first half of 2018 has not been an exceptional one for new releases. However, that doesn\u2019t mean there hasn\u2019t been some brilliant albums released so far this year. While last year had some incredible albums (like Kendrick Lamar\u2019s \u201CDamn,\u201D Lorde\u2019s \u201CMelodrama,\u201D and Noel Gallagher\u2019s High Flying Birds' "Who Built the Moon?"), this year hasn\u2019t quite matched up to those standards. However, we are only halfway through the year and as such, we have also seen some fantastic new albums released in the last few months that are worth mentioning. There may not be many great new albums out at the moment \u2013 but these five are definitely among the best.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The History of Hip Hop Music: The Influential Years

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Hip hop music is a universal language. It has proven to be a way for people from different cultures and backgrounds to come together and express themselves. From its humble beginnings in New York City, hip hop has grown into a worldwide sensation, with local scenes spawning in cities across the globe. This article explores the history of hip-hop music, from its roots as an underground movement in the early 1980s to its predominance as one of the most popular genres today.
Fans of rap music are undoubtedly aware that this style of music has origins in New York City during the 1970s and 1980s, but there is much more to know about how exactly it came about and how it evolved over time. From breakdancing to rapping, we\u2019ll explore all of the elements that blended together to form what we now call \u201Chip-hop\u201D today.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
